content.description: This is an all natural variation to Total Recall that breaks off to the right at its crux and finishes just left of Fruit Bowl. After the jug rest of TR (7th bolt, use runner) set up for the crux but continue cruxing to the right with a few ambitious and improbable long moves. Chase a couple more clips up thoughtful climbing up to and over smooth bulges.
content.protection: A dozen bolts if starting with Total Recall. Probably the same if starting with Joker

content.description: Hard and reachy with few or no intermediates.  I've heard it's quality though.
content.location: First route on the right of the White Wall.

content.description:
Combo of Total Recall and The Joker. 

  Climb the first part of Total Recall clipping 4 bolts and then finish up on The Joker.
A three bolt variation of Stone Free that tacks on a boulder problem start in lieu of the easy beginning dihedral of the original line. Stick clip the first bolt.
content.protection: 11 bolts to chain anchors with fixed carabiners.
content.location: In between the original start of Stone Free and Sling Fest.

content.description: Climbs the arete on the left side of the white wall. Fun movement, although there is some choss here and there.
content.location: Left of the joker. Starts from the ground, not the ledge.

content.description: This route is very featured at the start and gets harder and steeper as you go up.
content.protection: 6 or so bolts to chains.  Please don't toprope out of the chains.
content.location: This route is the first one on the right on this wall.  It is on a formation by itself and has extremely featured rock at the start. It is approximately 20 feet to the right of Mordor.

content.description: Might be the longest route at The Pit.Ascends the face and arete to the left of The Joker.Starts the same as Stone Free and shares the first 3 bolts.

Start up Stone Free until below the crux, angle up right until on the hand rail ledge on Joker after its first hard section. Traverse horizontally right until below the little overlap on Total Recall after its first hard section. Follow Total Recall all the way to the top. Now someone needs to link it into Total Fruit Cake.

 I did this a long time ago, just guessing about the year. This was when Total Recall still had the golf ball hold on the entry to the upper wall and the chipped pocket. Doing it today without the pocket would obviously be much harder 13c?. I just wanted to add it to the record as some people were saying it was still to be done. I used several long slings and 9 m.m. rope to avoid drag.
content.protection: All the bolts on the existing routes it links up

content.description: A bouldery link-up of Total Recall and The Joker. Climb to the 6th bolt on Total Recall and then move left to a bolt in the steep bulge (pre-hanging this draw is recommended). Finish the boulder problem by climbing into the last few moves of the crux of The Joker. This route would be classic if it wasn’t a link-up.

Combo of The Joker and Total Recall.

Climb the first part of The Joker clipping 4 bolts and finish on Total Recall.

Starts on featured rock to a funky squeeze around a block to reach the anchors. 

  Details: Mordor starts with some pocket pulling up to a small bulge/roof. Once you get past that, you run up about fifteen feet of slab to where the wall goes to slightly overhanging again. Pull up and out a bit left on good pockets and the wall eases back to vertical. Work edges and pockets up to the finishing block, that has cracks on both sides. Some like the left, some like to offwidth the right side. Don't forget to clip the last bolt on the outside of the block!
content.protection: 8 bolts to chains.  Please don't toprope off the chains.

content.description: This is an endurance fest- or not.  Hard start to balancy moves to steep moves to a rest.  Then the crux comes in a sequency move out a crescent shaped hold.  Then don't mess up getting to the anchors.
content.protection: Many bolts to chain anchors.  Make sure you don't lower your climber all the way to the ground, just to the ledge, or you may lower them off the rope.

content.description: Bouldery start to easier ground.  Gets steep and hard again after crossing the big crack.  In your face until the anchors.
content.location: Left most route at the shooting gallery right before the break that begins the White Wall.    Basically about fifteen feet to the left of the start to Mordor.

content.description:
The White Wall is the most impressive long unbroken face at The Pit, and home to some of it's hardest routes. It includes routes from Shock Treatment on the left, over to Sporte on the right.

Sunny until late in the afternoon.
